title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
description: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

items.content_html:
Magento versions 2.4.1 (and earlier), 2.4.0-p1 (and earlier) and 2.3.6 (and earlier) are vulnerable to OS command injection via the scheduled operation module. Successful exploitation could lead to arbitrary code execution by an authenticated attacker. Access to the admin console is required for successful exploitation.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-21018
  • https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/magento/apsb21-08.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-rv48-v862-mp92
items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento OS Command Injection

items.content_html:
Magento versions 2.4.1 (and earlier), 2.4.0-p1 (and earlier) and 2.3.6 (and earlier) are vulnerable to OS command injection via the scheduled operation module. items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento OS Command Injection

items.content_html:
Cross-site scripting vulnerability in ADOdb versions prior to 5.20.6 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via unspecified vectors.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2016-4855
  • https://github.com/ADOdb/ADOdb/issues/274
  • https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201701-59
  • http://jvn.jp/en/jp/JVN48237713/index.html
  • http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/92753
  • https://github.com/ADOdb/ADOdb/commit/ecb93d8c1fd3bbde62aca9c3a13c32f077da2da8
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-hhfw-xxhm-pf32
items.title: [adodb/adodb-php] ADOdb Cross-site scripting vulnerability in old test script

items.content_html:
Magento versions 2.4.1 (and earlier), 2.4.0-p1 (and earlier) and 2.3.6 (and earlier) are vulnerable to an access control bypass vulnerability in the Login as Customer module. Successful exploitation could lead to unauthorized access to restricted resources.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-21020
  • https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/magento/apsb21-08.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-2j6v-829g-885q
items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento Improper Access Control

items.content_html:
Magento versions 2.4.1 (and earlier), 2.4.0-p1 (and earlier) and 2.3.6 (and earlier) are vulnerable to an access control bypass vulnerability in the Login as Customer module. Successful exploitation could lead to unauthorized access to restricted resources.

References

  • https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/magento/apsb21-08.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-2j6v-829g-885q
items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento Improper Access Control

items.content_html:
Magento versions 2.4.1 (and earlier), 2.4.0-p1 (and earlier) and 2.3.6 (and earlier) do not adequately invalidate user sessions. Successful exploitation could lead to unauthorized access to restricted resources. Access to the admin console is not required for successful exploitation.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-21031
  • https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/magento/apsb21-08.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4h3p-63x6-vwg2
items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento Insufficient Session Expiration

items.content_html:

Magento versions 2.4.1 (and earlier), 2.4.0-p1 (and earlier) and 2.3.6 (and earlier) do not adequately invalidate user sessions. Successful exploitation of this issue could lead to unauthorized access to restricted resources. Access to the admin console is not required for successful exploitation.

items.content_html:
Magento versions 2.4.1 (and earlier), 2.4.0-p1 (and earlier) and 2.3.6 (and earlier) are vulnerable to a stored cross-site scripting vulnerability in the admin console. Successful exploitation could lead to arbitrary JavaScript execution in the victim's browser. Access to the admin console is required for successful exploitation.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-21023
  • https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/magento/apsb21-08.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-h5rm-m772-6qcx
items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento stored cross-site scripting vulnerability in the admin console

items.content_html:
Magento versions 2.4.1 (and earlier), 2.4.0-p1 (and earlier) and 2.3.6 (and earlier) are affected by a blind SQL injection vulnerability in the Search module. Successful exploitation could lead to unauthorized access to restricted resources by an unauthenticated attacker. Access to the admin console is required for successful exploitation.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-21024
  • https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/magento/apsb21-08.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-rj4f-cp4v-hvcv
items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento Blind SQL Injection in the Search module

items.content_html:
Magento versions 2.4.1 (and earlier), 2.4.0-p1 (and earlier) and 2.3.6 (and earlier) are affected by a blind SQL injection vulnerability in the Search module. Successful exploitation could lead to unauthorized access to restricted resources by an unauthenticated attacker. Access to the admin console is required for successful exploitation.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-21024
  • https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/magento/apsb21-08.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-rj4f-cp4v-hvcv
items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento Blind SQL Injection in the Search module

items.content_html:
cnvs.io Canvas 3.3.0 has XSS in the title and content fields of a "Posts > Add New" action, and during creation of new tags and users.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-8298
  • https://github.com/cnvs/canvas/issues/331
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-3657-q433-mmpx
items.title: [austintoddj/canvas] Canvs Canvas Cross-site Scripting (XSS) via title and content fields

items.content_html:
Magento versions 2.4.1 (and earlier), 2.4.0-p1 (and earlier) and 2.3.6 (and earlier) are vulnerable to a stored cross-site scripting (XSS) in the customer address upload feature. Successful exploitation could lead to arbitrary JavaScript execution in the victim's browser. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-21030
  • https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/magento/apsb21-08.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-6988-g89m-27vf
items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento stored cross-site scripting (XSS) in the customer address upload feature

Successful exploitation could lead to arbitrary JavaScript execution in the victim's browser. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction.

items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento stored cross-site scripting (XSS) in the customer address upload feature

items.content_html:
A cross-site request forgery vulnerability in Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2 can cause unwanted items to be added to a shopper's cart due to an insufficiently robust anti-CSRF token implementation.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7857
  • https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.2-2.2.9-and-2.1.18-security-update-33
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-f6ww-vqw2-xp3v
items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)

items.content_html:
A remote code execution vulnerability exists in Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.10, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.3 or 2.3.2-p1. An authenticated user with admin privileges to manipulate shippment settings can execute arbitrary code through server-side request forgery due to unsafe handling of a carrier gateway.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-8151
  • https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.3-and-2.2.10-security-update
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-f73h-224c-62qr
items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF)
